feature1.explanation: Both texts exhibit consistent use of commas to separate clauses and provide additional information.

feature2.explanation: Text 1 discusses elections and power distribution using formal language, while text 2 uses informal language and slang. This stark contrast in lexical choice suggests differing writing styles.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 contains longer and more complex sentences that are focused on providing explanations. Text 2, on the other hand, has shorter and more direct sentences with a confrontational tone.

feature4.explanation: Text 1 maintains a neutral and informative tone discussing election systems. Text 2, however, has a more opinionated and accusatory tone towards politicians.

feature5.explanation: Both texts are free from spelling and typographical errors.

overall.explanation: Considering the differences in lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, and text/discourse features, it is unlikely that the two texts were written by the same author.
